roleset.name: apply pressure to
roleset.note: SQUEEZE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'squeeze' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entries knead-26.5, push-12-1-1, touch-20-1 (from squeeze.01-v)
SQUEEZE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on squeeze-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls knead-26.5, touch-20-1, wipe_manner-10.4.1. (from squeeze.01-n)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Airlines also say their frequent-flier programs are squeezing profits because awards are being redeemed at a heavier-than-normal rate.
example.arg: because awards are being redeemed at a heavier-than-normal rate

example.name: with GOL. arg1 is being compressed, no liquid is being removed
example.text: ``[Fast-food franchisers]-1 have managed [*-1]to squeeze in stores into every corner available.''

example.name: just arg0
example.text: tight supplies next spring could leave the wheat futures market susceptible to a supply - demand squeeze

example.name: arg1
example.text: many of China 's big infrastructural projects have been canceled or postponed because of the squeeze on domestic and foreign credit .

example.name: args 0 and 1
example.text: ... his look and his squeeze of his hand told that he knew his acquaintances and what they said to him.

example.name: Arg0,1
example.text: One expects to be squashed within a tightly compressed space, the result of his squeezing the center beneath the tube.

roleset.name: apply pressure with the intent of extracting something
roleset.note: SQUEEZE-V NOTES: Member of VNcls funnel-9.3, wipe_manner-10.4.1, (from squeeze.02-v)

example.name: squeeze out of
example.text: But it's hard *trace* to squeeze much profit out of the personal-computer business these days, and the workstation market, while important, is too small to rely on for much growth.

example.name: misparsed squeeze out of
example.text: Norman Berry, the creative executive who *trace* was apparently squeezed out of Ogilvy& Mather in June, is returning to Ogilvy's parent company, WPP Group PLC.

example.name: squeeze from
example.text: John can squeeze blood from turnips.

roleset.name: reduce
roleset.note: SQUEEZE-V NOTES: Sorta nasty compromise on the "down from" phrase. (from squeeze.03-v)

role.descr: End point, end state of arg1

example.name: stupid stock reports again
example.text: These and other problems squeezed Federal's profit margins last year to 8%, down from more than 13% annually in the first half of the decade.
example.arg: from more than 13% annually in the first half of the decade

roleset.name: extract or erradicate by means of pressure

example.name: extract
example.text: This has squeezed out local productions and decimated file industries in many coutnries, as well as * reducing cinema from an art-form to a spectacle, from which viewers expect simply visual and auditory entertainment *T*.

example.name: erradicate
example.text: [Popular culture]-1 has encroached upon the realm of pure art and now seems [*]-1 intent on * squeezing it out altogether.
